data.name: Count Mirror Primes
data.description:
Let's call number n a "mirror prime" if n itself is a prime and a number with the same digits but in reverse order is also prime.

For example: 13 - is prime, 31 (mirror of 13) - also prime number.

In this kata you should count all mirror primes (not the pairs of them like 13-31, 11-11, 17-71, 2-2) in a range from a to b inclusive. You should return the amount of such primes in a given range.

If input (a or b) is invalid - a and b should be natural and a must be less or equal than b - return -1.

Good luck with this kata!

I found this problem on https://www.eolymp.com/uk/problems - cool and useful site if you want to train in olympiad level programming.
